title: Firefox using wrong ICC profile when copying and pasting images
content:
I'm using firefox 97 on mac. Whenever I copy and paste an image from firefox, the image comes out desaturated as if it is using the wrong color profile. I tried changing the gfx.color_management settings without it improving. The images look fine and are the right colors in the browser, however, the issue only happens when I copy and paste images. Firefox behaves like the color management is disabled (set to 0 in config) but ONLY when copying and pasting images.

I do not have this issue with other browsers such as chrome.
creator: dndraccts

title: TV Streaming
content: I have been a Firefox user from its earliest days, but getting increasingly frustrated with (perhaps unanticipated) problems arising from its security settings. I cannot now access my (paid) TV stream on https://www.virginmediatv.ie/en.html (in Ireland). The site loads, but with no content visible. I can receive it without any problems in Google Chrome but would, after so many years, prefer not to change my default. I have disabled adblocker extensions etc. but to no avail. Problem occured (I think) after last update to 97.0.1 (64-bit). How do I resolve?

creator: davidhonor

title: Firefox video downloader addons never work
content:
Hello all, I must admit that I am about to completely give up on Firefox browser as it keeps getting less and less convenient to use....

My most recent issue is that I cannot find a single video downloader application that will work on any website that plays videos. I used to use Any Video Downloader, but as the Firefox people kept updating the browser that fell off, and doesn't work anymore. Then for about the last year or so, i had been using the Video Downloadhelper addon, but recently that no longer will work either because it is demanding that I upgrade the Companion app., except it will not allow me to install it because of Apple Macintosh security stupidity, so I cannot use that now. Other than those two addons, none of the others seem to find a video that they can download half the time. This includes all the recommendations I have found online including the 'Video Downloader Pro', which cannot find a suitable format for most online videos, and the 'Video Downloader professional' which also cannot seem to even find videos on websites that clearly have a video playing. I have tried many others as well, but none of them are reliable to work on any video I find, and I am sick to death of desperately trying to find a working downloader addon that will not be patched out by the Mozilla team next month, so that they can 'keep with the times' or whatever. Can anyone suggest a useful addon to download videos from websites that will work for ANY videos I find anywhere please?? Thanks in advance!!

PS. I think I got it to work by going to about:config, and changing the 'media.play-stand-alone' to False, but that still leaves only the ability to download the videos in HUGE files, like at least 300mb or more, which is also not a good solution.

title: Restoring tabs after crashing
content:
A firefox crash seems to have a corrupted profile, And I'm trying to somehow restore both witch tabs where on what window and what tabs where open, with it being over 1000 or more I want to open them in a new profile in the same windows they where in before, the list is extractable from the data. just getting firefox to open a large list of links in order and know witch one goes with witch windows should be possible. most poste on this are out of date. 3 hours of messing around with this and still nothing.

I would like to know in this link how to do the Save embedded session witch I can't seem to have grayed out, as well as with the "sessionhist(sessionstore(sessionstore_jsonlz4)_json).html" I'd like to know how to see where each window is in the tabs list, and is there a way to make Firefox open a list of tabs from a document, weather naively or an inspect element trick or small script (not an addon something I can't read myself). people seem to say that firefox can open the uncompressed ones it seems like it can't either that or the tool (scrounger) isn't up to date enough.

my session is backed up but when opened or restored crash right as windows start to render (when firefox opens it will open the windows without rendering the details like it should then right as it transitions to starting to render it crashes.) there's an error that shows up when run from the terminal when run from safe mode in this state at time of crashing. seems to be java related.

"ExceptionHandler::GenerateDump cloned child 11238 ExceptionHandler::SendContinueSignalToChild sent continue signal to child ExceptionHandler::WaitForContinueSignal waiting for continue signal... Exiting due to channel error. Exiting due to channel error. Exiting due to channel error."


https://www.jeffersonscher.com/res/scrounger.html

Just getttig my tabs and windows back with out manually doing it would be a huge help. but if it wasn't clear in any of the out puts of this site or using something similar how do I see where it goes from listing one windows tabs to another. this is my first post forgive my formatting.

Alex

title: Sürekli Güncelleme Kontrolü
content:
Merhaba, 2 gündür Firefox sürekli güncelleme kontrol ediyor. Her açtığımda ediyor, her yeni sekmede tekrar ediyor. İş yapmak azap oldu. Sayfalar bu yüzden geç yükleniyor ya da hiç yüklenmiyor, hata veriyor. Sabah araştıdım ve Sorun Gidermeden tarayıcıyı yeniledim. Sorun değişmedi. Hala devam ediyor.

Üstünde Browsec VNP çalışıyor ama 1 yıldır çalışıyor. Hiç sorun olmamıştı daha önce. Güncellemeyi kaldırmayı denedim ama kaldırma/devreden çıkarma gibi bir seçenek yok. Derdimi çözemiyorum.

Can someone help me please?
